Datasets

Not sure if this is a data source, but has extensive summary info Portland Police Bureau Traffic Stops & Use of Force Traffic stops: https://www.portlandoregon.gov/police/65520 Use of force: https://www.portlandoregon.gov/police/76875 Classical Iris Titanic MNIST (digit recognition) Repositories / Sources

UCI Machine Learning Repository https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/index.php 497 relatively clean datasets

Kaggle https://www.kaggle.com/ 19,000 datasets including COVID-19

US Census Bureau https://data.census.gov/cedsci/

data.gov https://www.data.gov/

Google Books Ngram Viewer https://books.google.com/ngrams

General Social Survey https://gss.norc.org/

World Values Survey http://www.worldvaluessurvey.org/wvs.jsp

Roper iPoll https://ropercenter-cornell-edu.library.lcproxy.org/CFIDE/cf/action/ipoll/index.cfm

World Bank https://data.worldbank.org/

FiveThirtyEight https://data.fivethirtyeight.com/

USGS Earthquake Data https://www.usgs.gov/natural-hazards/earthquake-hazards/data-tools

IMDb https://www.imdb.com/interfaces/

OpenStreetMap https://www.openstreetmap.org/#map=14/45.4438/-122.7249 https://www.openstreetmap.org/traces

Twitter https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs

DrivenData https://www.drivendata.org/

Hack Oregon http://www.hackoregon.org/

data.oregon.gov https://data.oregon.gov/

NYT COVID data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data

Jeremy Singer-Vine’s huge collection of available data sets (Data is Plural) https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wZhPLMCHKJvwOkP4juclhjFgqIY8fQFMemwKL2c64vk/edit#gid=0 See also his email list, https://tinyletter.com/data-is-plural

Gapminder https://www.gapminder.org/data/

Our World in Data https://ourworldindata.org/

Tidy Tuesday https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday https://www.youtube.com/user/safe4democracy/search?query=tidy Built In StackOverflow on some sample datasets built into Python libraries: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28417293/sample-datasets-in-pandas

Scikit-Learn: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/datasets/index.html Boston house prices, iris, diabetes, digits, linnerud (physical fitness), wine, breast cancer

R datasets (which can also be accessed through Python): https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/datasets.html

Keras: https://keras.io/api/datasets/ MNIST, CIFAR (10 and 100), IMDb movie review sentiment, Reuters newswire, MNIST fashion, Boston house prices

TensorFlow: https://www.tensorflow.org/datasets/catalog/overview Many, although most are too complex for simple regression.

Our World in Data: https://ourworldindata.org/

CDC Covid: https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#datatracker-home
